summary: This is a monthly asset account portfolio statement from Morgan Guaranty Trust Company (JPMorgan) for the Financial Trust Company, Inc. for October 1999. It details account activity, including a significant wire transfer of $18.3 million to Bear Stearns for the benefit of Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Scott/Dencker
persons.context: Listed as the service specialist for the Financial Trust Company, Inc. account at Morgan Guaranty Trust Company.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Named as the beneficiary of an $18.3 million wire transfer from the Financial Trust Company, Inc. account to Bear Stearns.

connections.description: A wire transfer of $18.3 million was sent from the Financial Trust Company, Inc. account to Bear Stearns for the benefit of Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Wire Transfer to Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: An $18.3 million wire transfer was made from the Financial Trust Company, Inc. account at Morgan Guaranty to Bear Stearns for the benefit of Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Account Funding and Purchase
events.description: $20 million was transferred into the account and used to purchase J.P. Morgan Institutional Prime Money Market Fund shares.

events.title: Additional Purchase
events.description: An additional $5 million was used to purchase more shares of the J.P. Morgan Institutional Prime Money Market Fund.

locations: American Yacht Harbor (address for Financial Trust Company, Inc.)
New York, NY (location of J.P. Morgan Private Client Services)
keyFacts: A substantial wire transfer of $18,300,000 was made on October 19, 1999, from the Financial Trust Company, Inc. account to Bear Stearns for the benefit of Ghislaine Maxwell.
The Financial Trust Company, Inc. account held over $6.7 million in cash and short-term assets as of October 31, 1999.
The account was managed by Morgan Guaranty Trust Company of New York (JPMorgan) with a service specialist named Scott/Dencker.
The document is a standard financial portfolio statement, indicating the routine management of large sums of money connected to entities associated with the Epstein case.
